cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn sharply north on Friday and then track generally north‐northwest toward southern New England/Long Island late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England (Long Island or Rhode Island coastline)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from the Mid-Atlantic to southern New England, especially Long Island, Rhode Island and southeastern Massachusetts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty conditions possible late Sunday into Monday, with peak gusts 25–35 mph; sustained tropical-storm force winds are unlikely (<10% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge impact expected in Delaware Bay or the Delaware River near the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain associated with Henri’s outer bands could bring roughly 1–3 inches to the Philadelphia area Sunday–Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf expected along the New Jersey and Delaware beaches through the weekend, which may disrupt pilot transfers and lightering operations.
